item.title: About me
item.description: My name is Le Chang. I'm a student pursing PhD degree. My research field is the distributed control technology in network control systems. E-mail: le@lchang.me

item.title: Design of the distributed observers
item.description: Consider the distributed observer design problem for nonlinear systems. The framework can be represented as below. Problem formulate The plant system is modelled as $$ \dot{X}=AX+F(t,X) $$ where $ X=(x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n)^T \in R^n $, matrix $A {\in R^{n\times n}}$ and nonlinear term $F(t,X):[0, T)\times R^n\rightarrow R^n$ have the following form $$A=\begin{pmatrix} 0 & \delta_{1} & \cdots & 0 \\ \vdots & \vdots & & \vdots \\ 0 & 0 & \cdots & \delta_{n-1} \\

item.title: Publish
item.description: Papers Output feedback regulation of a class of triangular structural nonlinear systems with unknown measurement sensitivity International Journal of Systems Science 2019-10 | journal-article DOI: 10.1080/00207721.2019.1671529 On Designing Distributed Prescribed Finite-Time Observers for Strict-Feedback Nonlinear Systems IEEE Transactions on Cybernetics 2019 | journal-article DOI: 10.1109/TCYB.2019.2951067 Global asymptotic stabilization for input-delay chained nonholonomic systems via the static gain approach Journal of the Franklin Institute
